Our courses provide a rich learning experience that will allow you to develop critical business skills in areas such as business... Read more...
title: Fundamentals of Professional Cleaning
headline: This free online course gives you the essential skills and knowledge required to become a professional cleaner.
description: Many people find cleaning jobs to be engaging and fulfilling. Are you one of them? This course will teach you all you need to know about professional cleaning services and how to start and run a successful cleaning business. Learn what goes into cleaning indoor and outdoor areas and how to work safely and correctly with cleaning agents. Also, we will discuss critical topics such as insurance policy, taxes, work hours and more. Enrol now.
courseDescription:
Providing cleaning services in the UK is a lucrative business that can yield high profits. To keep their houses, offices, factories and hospitals in perfect condition, most companies and people rely on the services of professional cleaners. In this course, we closely examine the features of the cleaning profession, such as the work hours, work conditions and remuneration. You will also learn about the typical cleaning jobs, the equipment, clothing and products you often use.

Next, you will study the proper cleaning procedure for basic indoor areas like offices, bathrooms and toilets, as well as home and commercial kitchens where food is stored. Then learn to organise outside cleaning tasks, including making a schedule and taking necessary precautions against potential hazards. Finally, we will illustrate the various waste containers and how to keep things tidy and under control while disposing of waste.

There are many considerations to be made before launching a cleaning company. In this course's final section, you will understand the practical skills for developing a business strategy and setting financial goals. We will also address the fundamentals of personnel management and customer service. After that, you will study the ins and outs of advertising, company promotion and finance management. If you are interested in gaining more insight into the cleaning industry, sign up for this course and start learning today.

Start Course Now

• Learning Outcomes

  • Having completed this module you will be able to:
    • List the specialist equipment, products and protective clothing needed for cleaning services
    • Recognize the common types of cleaning jobs in the UK
    • Explain how to deal with routine and non-routine waste
    • Discuss how to plan and start a cleaning business
    • Estimate the average hourly and annual wages of a professional cleaner

  • Lesson Summary

  • The key points from this module are:
  • In the UK, cleaning can be performed at any hour of the day or night, but it often takes place outside normal hours because it involves disruption that can interfere with the main business of a company or establishment.
  • Below are some types of cleaning you will likely encounter in different industries.
    1. Dirty jobs: This includes hospitality, food manufacturing, healthcare and local authority cleaning.
    2. Intermediate conditions: This includes window cleaning, domestic cleaning and carpet cleaning.
    3. Comparatively clean environments: This includes corporate cleaning and ironing.
  • Cleaning jobs must be performed with adequate specialist clothing, products and equipment. The nature and costs of basic cleaning equipment depend on the type of cleaning.
  • House cleaning is the grassroots of cleaning work. Cleaners often work on their own and generally make a space habitable and tidy through dusting, bleaching and polishing.
  • Cleanliness and hygiene are of paramount importance in domestic and commercial food kitchens. Kitchens should be cleaned methodically from top to bottom using standard products and equipment or client-approved products.
